rules.text: Persistent.
SPI + [conflict]: Scare [2] off the loitering carrion-eater to place this being on top of the path deck. If you fail, suffer 1 injury.
If this being is along the way, move it within reach. »» It fatigues you.
If this being is within reach, and you have 3 or more fatigue, exhaust it. »» Suffer 1 injury.
Ambush.
If there is another active predator, the atrox pounces. »» Add 2[harm] to that predator and 1[harm] to this being.
If you have 2 or more fatigue, exhaust this being. »» Suffer 1 injury.
SPI + [connection]: Listen for the meadowlark's song of warning to move your [Ranger Token] to this being.
Response: Before a being moves or enters play within reach, you may remove your [Ranger Token] from this prey to exhaust that being.
If there is an active predator, exhaust it. »» Add [harm] to this being equal to that predator's presence.
AWA + [connection]: Watch [2] for opportunistic carnivores to move your [Ranger Token] to this feature.
If your [Ranger Token] is not on this feature, exhaust this feature. »» Search the path deck for the next predator and put it into play.
If there is an active predator, exhaust it. »» Add [harm] to this feature equal to that predator's presence.
Obstacle.
FOC + [conflict]: Break [2] the bladed coils to add 1[harm] to this feature for every 2 effort. If you fail, suffer 1 injury.
Add 1[harm] to each being within reach.
Obstacle.
AWA + [exploration]: Scramble [2] up the slope of shifting rocks to add 3[progress] to this feature for every 2 effort. If you fail, resolve its [Mountain] challenge effect.
Move this card within reach. »» It fatigues you. Move each being that is within reach to another area.
If this feature is within reach, shuffle it into the path deck. »» Suffer 1 injury.
During your turn, if your [Ranger Token] is on this feature, you may treat obstacles as if they did not have the obstacle keyword.
SPI + [reason]: Brace [3] yourself for the ride to move your [Ranger Token] to this feature.
Response: When you travel, if all [Ranger Tokens] are on this feature, you may travel to a location up to 2 paths away. Use the terrain of the second path when building the path deck.
